alert.note: Alert for Catoosa (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 9:52PM EST until February 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...Tennessee... West Chickamauga Creek near Fort Oglethorpe affecting Hamilton and Catoosa Counties. For the North GA Chickamauga Creek Basin...including Fort Oglethorpe, Ringgold...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to begin early Thursday morning. * WHERE...West Chickamauga Creek near Fort Oglethorpe. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...Between 9 and 11 feet, Bankfull conditions are reached along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 146 or Cloud Springs Road bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 11 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 12/24/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
